CA_CE_CONCESSIONAIRE_PROFILE.ADDRESS: Contract and Commissioning Unit, Civic Centre

TITLE_CONTRACT.P: FGS002/2018 Short Breaks for Children and Young People with Disabilities

JUSTIFICATION.P: Justification for a framework agreement, the duration of which exceeds 4 years: This Light Touch Regime Framework Agreement is being let under Regulation 74 to 77 of the Public Contract Regulations 2015 (Light Touch Regime, LTR) under which the Council has flexibility as to the process or procedure to be used

SHORT_CONTRACT_DESCRIPTION.P: Middlesbrough Council is actively seeking to improve the range of services which it commissions to provide Short Breaks for Children and Young People with disabilities. The Council wishes to promote the welfare needs of Children and Young People and to meet the needs of families with caring responsibilities.

LOT_DESCRIPTION.P: Personal Support Services will provide Children and young people with disabilities an individual support service that is personalised to meet their individual needs. Personal Support can range from providing personal care in the child’s home to support in accessing community and leisure opportunities.

TOTAL_QUANTITY_OR_SCOPE.P: Middlesbrough Council requires the provision of personal support services to develop and support Children and Young people with disabilities as individuals, to minimise the barriers they face and provide opportunities for their inclusion into mainstream and universal activities of their choice within their local communities.

The services should take into account the individual and unique nature of each Child and Young Person and should be planned in conjunction with children and young people with disabilities and their families in accordance with their assessed needs.
These services could include, but are not limited to, one or more of the following:
— Access to leisure and community activities,
— Low level health care tasks not requiring a nursing qualification,
All car journeys during the Short Break must be within 20 miles of child or young person’s permanent residence unless otherwise agreed within the child’s plan.
Mileage claims of over 20 miles as stated above will not be approved without a written agreement from the Social worker or Short Breaks Facilitator.
Parents and carers are expected to meet the costs of any refreshments and/or activities that take place during the Short Break for their child or young person.
Personal support services are required to take place both inside and outside the family home.
— Provide a one-off response (planned or emergency),
— Be responsive to staffing requirements on a individual basis e.g. 1 staff working with more than one Child or Young person where appropriate.
— 24 hours per day 7 days per week to meet the needs of the Child or young person on an individual basis.

Children and Young People accessing Short Breaks have a wide range of needs and therefore it is required that all service providers will be able to offer a flexible and personalised service to meet the needs of each child or young person in accordance with their social care plan.

The Service Provider will offer a service to any Child or Young Person with disabilities that the Council has determined to meet the eligibility criteria. The needs of the Child or Young person may include but are not limited to the following:

LOT_DESCRIPTION.P: Activity and Group work services will provide Children and young people with disabilities access to a wide range of experiences and opportunities. They will be designed to enable Children and young people with disabilities to have fun, socialise, learn new skills and have the same opportunities as non-disabled peers.

TOTAL_QUANTITY_OR_SCOPE.P: Middlesbrough Council requires the provision of groups and activities to provide individuals and/or groups a range of activities that could include, but is not limited to:
Groups and activities could include but are not limited to:
— Play Services — Age appropriate group based activities,
— Group based activities for children aged 11-14 (key stage 3) or 15-18 (key stage 4),
All times to be in line with Middlesbrough Borough Council’s academic year.
— school holidays: Monday-Friday up to 13 weeks,
— weekend: saturday and or sunday all year round up to 52 weeks.
— weekday: After school/ evenings term time up to 39 weeks.

Children and Young People accessing Short Breaks have a wide range of needs and therefore it is required that all service providers will be able to offer a flexible and personalised service to meet the needs of each child or young person in accordance with their social care plan.

The Service Provider will offer a service to any Child or Young Person with disabilities that the Council has determined to meet the eligibility criteria. The needs of the Child or Young person may include but are not limited to the following:
— Complex Health needs including life-limiting illness,
Where possible it is expected that Group activities will be planned in conjunction with the Short Breaks team to ensure parity of provision across communities in Middlesbrough.
The contract will be for an initial 2 year period, with option to extend for a further 24 months, a further 12 months and a further 12 months.

OPTION_DESCRIPTION.P: The contract will be for an initial 2 year period, with option to extend for a further 24 months, a further 12 months and a further 12 months.

MAIN_FINANCING_CONDITIONS.P: Full details of the information to be provided are detailed in the tender documentation.

LEGAL_FORM.P: In the case of group bidders, the group will be expected to take legal form.

T_CAPACITY_INFORMATION.P: Full details of the information to be provided are detailed in the tender documentation.

ADDITIONAL_INFORMATION.P: The Council may periodically open the framework for new applicants, particularly if it intends to increase capacity
